Class MovieAddEditViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.MovieAddEditViewController
public class MovieAddEditViewController extends Object
Controller class for adding or editing a pMovie within a theater management system. This class provides an interface to input pMovie details such as title and runtime, and handles saving or canceling actions.

  • Field Details

    • aMovieTitleTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField aMovieTitleTextField
      Represents a TextField for entering or editing the title of a pMovie.

      This field is part of the user interface for adding or editing pMovie details in the MovieAddEditViewController.

      It is expected that the input provided in this field will be validated or used as part of the process to save or edit pMovie records.

    • aRuntimeSpinner

      private javafx.scene.control.Spinner<Integer> aRuntimeSpinner
      Represents a Spinner component within the MovieAddEditViewController UI that allows the user to input or select the runtime (in minutes) for a pMovie. This spinner is designed to handle integer values.

      This field is annotated with @FXML, indicating it is injected from the associated FXML file.

    • aMovieService

      private final MovieService aMovieService
      A singleton instance of the MovieService used to manage the collection of movies. This service provides methods for retrieving, adding, updating, and removing pMovie entries. It ensures consistent access to the pMovie data across different parts of the application.

    • aEditingMovie

      private Movie aEditingMovie
      Represents the current pMovie being edited in the MovieAddEditViewController.

      This variable is used to store the Movie instance that the user is modifying within the view. If no pMovie is being edited, this value will be null. The title corresponding to the `editingMovie` can be displayed in the input field, but runtime modifications are not directly updated due to no public getter for runtime in the Movie class.

    • aUiService

      private final UIService aUiService
      A singleton instance of UIService used for managing common UI operations within the controller. Facilitates interactions such as showing alerts, loading FXML files, managing modal dialogs, and transitioning between windows.

  • Constructor Details

    • MovieAddEditViewController

      public MovieAddEditViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded. Sets up the runtime spinner with an integer value factory, defining a range from 1 to 1000, a default value of 90, and an increment step of 1.

    • onSaveButtonClick

      private void onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the pEvent triggered by the Save button click. Validates the input fields for pMovie title and runtime, and either adds a new pMovie or updates an existing pMovie in the system. Displays error messages for invalid inputs or exceptions. Closes the current window and opens the editor view upon successful operation.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the ActionEvent triggered by the Save button click

    • onCancelButtonClick

      private void onCancelButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the pEvent triggered by the Cancel button click. Navigates back to the editor view within the same stage. If an error occurs during the process of loading the FXML file, an alert is displayed with the error message.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the ActionEvent triggered by the Cancel button click

    • setEditingMovie

      public void setEditingMovie(Movie pMovie)
      Sets the pMovie being edited in the view controller. Updates the title text field with the pMovie's title if the provided pMovie is not null. The runtime spinner is not dynamically updated as the Movie class does not expose a runtime getter.
      Parameters:
      pMovie - the pMovie to be set as the one being edited; can be null
